overview: Ruth is a beautiful story of loyalty, redemption, and providence set during the dark period of judges. A Moabite widow's faithfulness leads her into the lineage of David and ultimately Jesus.

verses.text: But Ruth said, 'Do not urge me to leave you or to return from following you. For where you go I will go, and where you lodge I will lodge. Your people shall be my people, and your God my God.'
The LORD repay you for what you have done, and a full reward be given you by the LORD, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have come to take refuge!

passages.title: Ruth's Commitment
passages.summary: After losing her husband, Ruth refuses to leave her mother-in-law Naomi, pledging loyalty to her and to Israel's God.

passages.title: Boaz the Redeemer
passages.summary: Boaz acts as kinsman-redeemer, purchasing Naomi's land and marrying Ruth—a beautiful picture of Christ's redemption of His people.

facts.text: Ruth, a Moabite, is one of only five women mentioned in Jesus' genealogy in Matthew 1.
The book is read annually during the Jewish festival of Shavuot (Pentecost) because the story takes place during harvest.
Boaz as 'kinsman-redeemer' illustrates the concept of redemption—buying back what was lost—central to understanding Christ's work.
Ruth is the great-grandmother of King David, making her part of the royal and messianic line.

figures.name: Ruth
figures.description: A Moabite widow whose extraordinary loyalty and faith led her to leave everything for Israel's God. She became an ancestor of David and Jesus.

figures.name: Naomi
figures.description: Ruth's mother-in-law, whose bitterness turned to joy through God's providence. Her name means 'pleasant,' though she called herself 'Mara' (bitter) after her losses.

figures.name: Boaz
figures.description: A wealthy, honorable man who showed kindness to Ruth and became her kinsman-redeemer, a type of Christ who redeems His people.

videos.title: Ruth Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project's visual overview of this beautiful story of loyalty, redemption, and God's providence.
